name: amazonaws-com-ram-connector
description:
Use AWS Resource Access Manager to share AWS resources between AWS accounts. To
share a resource, you create a resource share, associate the resource with the
resource share, and specify the principals that can access the resource. The
following principals are supported:

 *  The ID of an AWS account
   
   
 *  The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an OU from AWS Organizations
   
   
 *  The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an organization from AWS Organizations
   
   

If you specify an AWS account that doesn't exist in the same organization as the
account that owns the resource share, the owner of the specified account
receives an invitation to accept the resource share. After the owner accepts the
invitation, they can access the resources in the resource share. An
administrator of the specified account can use IAM policies to restrict access
resources in the resource share.
